Project Configuration: Devices

Send comments on this topic.

Configuring Devices

As described in the FlashFX Tera Overview, each linear flash array is called a Device in FlashFX Tera terminology. This Device may technically consist of one or more flash chips. Multiple chips may be organized end-to-end, interleaved, or both. The FIM presents this a single linear flash array.

Configuring a Device involves choosing the FIM or FIMs to associate with the Device, and defining a number of characteristics about the Device. The ffxconf.h file contains a section of code similar to that shown below: 

        +---------------------------------------------------------------------+
        |                                                                     |
        |  #define FFX_MAX_DEVICES       (4)  /* Max Devices Supported */     |
        |                                                                     |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_FIMS         {&FFXFIM_nand, NULL}                 |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_NTMS         {&FFXNTM_pxa320, NULL}               |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_SETTINGS     {NULL, 0x0, 0x0, FFX_REMAINING}      |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_TIMING       {FFX_DEFAULT_TIMING_SETTINGS}        |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_LATENCY      {FFX_DEFAULT_LATENCY_SETTINGS}       |
        |  #define FFX_DEV0_BBM          {FFX_DEFAULT_BBM_SETTINGS}           |
        |                                                                     |
        |  /* Replicate these settings to configure additional Devices... */  |
        |                                                                     |
        +---------------------------------------------------------------------+

The details for the FFX_MAX_DEVICES, FFX_DEV0_FIMS, FFX_DEV0_NTMS, FFX_DEV0_SETTINGS, FFX_DEV0_TIMING, FFX_DEV0_LATENCY, and FFX_DEV0_BBM settings are covered in the "Project Settings Reference" section of this documentation.
